extension-point.name: Contains definition of chart device renderers
Contains definition of chart aggregate functions

property.defaultDisplayName: Maximum documents to search for runtime &metadata
property.name: rtMDSearchLimit

Function.desc: Returns the number of characters in string.
Function.name: charLength

Function.desc: Returns a string concatenated by all the given strings.
Function.name: concat

Function.desc: Searches for target in the string source and returns the index of first occurrence of pattern. Search starts at position start. All index values are 0-based. If start is omitted, a value of 0 is assumed. String search is case sensitive.
Function.name: indexOf

Function.desc: Returns the first n characters of the string str. If n is 0, an empty string is returned. If n is greater than the length of str, the entire string is returned. If n is omitted, a value of 1 is used.
Function.name: left

Function.desc: Returns the last n characters of the string str. If n is 0, an empty string is returned. If n is greater than the length of str, the entire string is returned. If n is omitted, a value of 1 is used.
Function.name: right

Function.desc: Similar to indexOf function, except that: (1) string comparison is case-insensitive (2) pattern string can contain wildcard characters: * matches any sequence of characters (including empty); ? matches any single character.
Function.name: search

Function.desc: Converts all of the characters in the String source to lower case.
Function.name: toLower

Function.desc: Converts all of the characters in the String source to upper case.
Function.name: toUpper

Function.desc: Removes all leading and trailing blank characters (space, TAB etc.). Also, all consecutive blank characters are consolidated into one.
Function.name: trim

Function.desc: Removes all leading blanks. Trailing blanks and blanks between words are not removed.
Function.name: trimLeft

Function.desc: Removes all trailing blanks. Leading blanks and blanks between words are not removed.
Function.name: trimRight

Function.desc: source is in the target range
Function.name: anyOf

Function.desc: TRUE if source is between target1 and target2. FALSE otherwise
Function.name: between

Function.desc: TRUE if source is not between target1 and target2. FALSE otherwise
Function.name: notBetween

Function.desc: source is equal to target
Function.name: equalTo

Function.desc: source is greater than target
Function.name: greaterThan

Function.desc: source is less than target
Function.name: lessThan

Function.desc: source is greater than or equal to target
Function.name: greaterOrEqual

Function.desc: source is less than or equal to target
Function.name: lessOrEqual

Function.desc: source is not equal to target
Function.name: notEqual

Function.desc: source matches SQL pattern target
Function.name: like

Function.desc: source does not match SQL pattern target
Function.name: notLike

Function.desc: source matches Javascript pattern target
Function.name: match

Function.desc: compare the two strings by the specified conditions
Function.name: compareString

Function.desc: Sum of the two numbers n1 and n2.
Function.name: add

Function.desc: n1 subtracts n2
Function.name: subtract

Function.desc: n1 multiplies n2. This function is only used for the backward compatibility of the function "multiply".
Function.name: multiple

Function.desc: n1 multiplies n2
Function.name: multiply

Function.desc: dividend is divided by divisor
Function.name: divide

Function.desc: Rounds a number to the specified number of digits. dec is an integer and can be negative. Default value for dec is 0 when omitted
Function.name: round

Function.desc: Rounds a number up, away from 0, to the specified number of digits. Default for dec is 0.
Function.name: roundUp

Function.desc: Rounds a number down, toward 0, to the specified number of digits. Default for dec is 0.
Function.name: roundDown

Function.desc: Rounds a number up, away from zero, to the nearest multiple of significance.
Function.name: ceiling

Function.desc: Remainder after number is divided by divisor. The result has the same sign as the divisor.
Function.name: mod

Function.desc: If the result from the dividend divided by the divisor is not zero or infinite then returns the result. Otherwise returns the given if Zero.
Function.name: safeDivide

Function.desc: Returns a Date object initialized with the given year, month, day, hours, minutes and seconds. (year, month, day are necessary; hours, minutes, seconds are optional)
Function.name: date

Function.desc: 4-digit year number of the given date/time value
Function.name: year

Function.desc: Quarter number (1 to 4) of the given date/time value
Function.name: quarter
month

Function.desc: Week number of the year (1 to 52) of date/time value d.
Function.name: week

Function.desc: Week number of the month of date/time value d ( (1 to 6).
Function.name: weekOfMonth

Function.desc: Day number of the month(1 to 31).
Function.name: day
weekDay

Function.desc: Day number of the week (1 to 7).
Function.name: dayOfWeek

Function.desc: Day number of the year (1 to 366).
Function.name: dayOfYear

Function.desc: Returns a timestamp value which is midnight of the current date.
Function.name: today

Function.desc: Returns the current timestamp.
Function.name: now

Function.desc: Return difference in number of years.
Function.name: diffYear

Function.desc: Return difference in number of months.
Function.name: diffMonth

Function.desc: Return difference in number of quarters.
Function.name: diffQuarter

Function.desc: Return difference in number of weeks.
Function.name: diffWeek

Function.desc: Return difference in number of days
Function.name: diffDay

Function.desc: Return difference in number of hours.
Function.name: diffHour

Function.desc: Return difference in number of minutes.
Function.name: diffMinute

Function.desc: Return difference in number of seconds.
Function.name: diffSecond

Function.desc: Add n year(s) to the date
Function.name: addYear

Function.desc: Add n month(s) to the date
Function.name: addMonth

Function.desc: Add n quarter(s) to the date
Function.name: addQuarter

Function.desc: Add n week(s) to the date
Function.name: addWeek

Function.desc: Add n day(s) to the date
Function.name: addDay

Function.desc: Add n hour(s) to the date
Function.name: addHour

Function.desc: Add n minute(s) to the date
Function.name: addMinute

Function.desc: Add n second(s) to the date
Function.name: addSecond

Function.desc: Returns the first day of year which the date falls.
Function.name: firstDayOfYear

Function.desc: Returns the first day of quarter which the date falls.
Function.name: firstDayOfQuarter

Function.desc: Returns the first day of month which the date falls.
Function.name: firstDayOfMonth

Function.desc: Returns the first day of week which the date falls.
Function.name: firstDayOfWeek

Function.desc: Returns the fiscal year for given date.
Function.name: fiscalYear

Function.desc: Returns the quarter of fiscal year for given date.
Function.name: fiscalQuarter

Function.desc: Returns the month of fiscal year for given date.
Function.name: fiscalMonth

Function.desc: Returns the week of fiscal year for given date.
Function.name: fiscalWeek

Function.desc: Returns the day of fiscal year for given date.
Function.name: fiscalDay

Function.desc: Returns the first day of fiscal year which the date falls.
Function.name: firstDayOfFiscalYear

Function.desc: Returns the first day of fiscal year which the date falls.
Function.name: firstDayOfFiscalYear

Function.desc: Returns the first day of fiscal week which the date falls.
Function.name: firstDayOfFiscalQuarter

Function.desc: Returns the first day of fiscal week which the date falls.
Function.name: firstDayOfFiscalQuarter

Function.desc: Returns the first day of fiscal month which the date falls.
Function.name: firstDayOfFiscalMonth

Function.desc: Returns the first day of fiscal month which the date falls.
Function.name: firstDayOfFiscalMonth

Function.desc: Returns the first day of fiscal week which the date falls.
Function.name: firstDayOfFiscalWeek

Function.desc: Returns the first day of fiscal week which the date falls.
Function.name: firstDayOfFiscalWeek

Function.desc: The depreciation of an asset for a given , single period using the double-declining balance method.
Function.name: ddb

Function.desc: the future value of an annuity based on periodic , constant payments, and on an unvarying interest rate.
Function.name: fv

Function.desc: The interest payment for a given period of an annuity, based on periodic , constant payments, and on an unvarying interest rate.
Function.name: ipmt

Function.desc: Internal rate of return of a series of periodic cash flows, payments and receipts, in an existing array
Function.name: irr

Function.desc: The modified rate of return for a series of periodic cash flows (payments and receipts) in an existing array.
Function.name: mirr

Function.desc: Number of periods for an annuity based on periodic, constant payments, and on an unvarying interest rate.
Function.name: nper

Function.desc: The net present value of a varying series of periodic cash flows, both positive and negative, at a given interest rate.
Function.name: npv

Function.desc: Computes the percentage of the two numbers
Function.name: percent

Function.desc: The payment for an annuity, based on periodic , constant payments, and on an unvarying interest rate.
Function.name: pmt

Function.desc: The principal payment for a given period of an annuity, based on an interest rate and a constant payment schedule.
Function.name: ppmt

Function.desc: The present value of an annuity based on periodic, constant payments to be paid in the future,and on an unvarying interest rate.
Function.name: pv

Function.desc: The interest rate per period for an annuity.
Function.name: rate

Function.desc: Straight-line depreciation of an asset for a single period.
Function.name: sln

Function.desc: Sum-of-years'-digits depreciation of an asset for a specified period.
Function.name: syd

Function.desc: Returns a date that results from adding the years, months, and days to the start date.
Function.name: addDate

Function.desc: Returns a date that results adding the hours, minutes, seconds to the start date.
Function.name: addTime

Function.desc: Returns a date that results from subtract the years, months, and days from the start date.
Function.name: subDate

Function.desc: Returns a date that results subtracting the hours, minutes, seconds from the start date.
Function.name: subTime

Function.desc: The number of the days between two dates
Function.name: days

Function.desc: The number of the hours between two dates
Function.name: hours

Function.desc: The number of the minutes between two dates
Function.name: minutes

Function.desc: The number of the months between two dates
Function.name: months

Function.desc: The number of the seconds between two dates
Function.name: seconds

Function.desc: The number of the years between two dates
Function.name: years

Function.desc: Obtains the value of the YEARS field as an integer value,* or 0 if not present. The lexicalDuration is the duration string presentation, "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS"(e.g. P5Y2M15DT4H40M20S )
Function.name: year

Function.desc: Obtains the value of the MONTHS field as an integer value,* or 0 if not present. The lexicalDuration is duration string presentation, "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS"(e.g. P5Y2M15DT4H40M20S )
Function.name: month

Function.desc: Obtains the value of the DAYS field as an integer value,* or 0 if not present. The lexicalDuration is duration string presentation, "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS"(e.g. P5Y2M15DT4H40M20S )
Function.name: day

Function.desc: Obtains the value of the HOURS field as an integer value,* or 0 if not present. The lexicalDuration is duration string presentation, "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS"(e.g. P5Y2M15DT4H40M20S )
Function.name: hour

Function.desc: Obtains the value of the MINUTES field as an integer value,* or 0 if not present. The lexicalDuration is duration string presentation, "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS"(e.g. P5Y2M15DT4H40M20S )
Function.name: minute

Function.desc: Obtains the value of the SECONDS field as integer value,* or 0 if not present. The lexicalDuration is duration string presentation, "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS"(e.g. P5Y2M15DT4H40M20S )
Function.name: second

Function.desc: Returns the length of the duration in milli-seconds. The lexicalDuration is the string presentation, "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS"(e.g. P5Y2M15DT4H40M20S ) The startDate argument is used to disambiguate this variance
Function.name: timeInMills

Function.desc: Checks if this lexicalDuration1 is strictly longer than another lexicalDuration2. For example, "P1D"(one day) > "PT12H"(12 hours) and "P2Y" (two years) > "P23M" (23 months)
Function.name: isLongerThan

Function.desc: Checks if lexicalDuration1 is strictly shorter than another lexicalDuration2. For example,"PT12H"(12 hours) < "P1D"(one day).
Function.name: isShorterThan

Function.desc: Computes a new duration whose value is lexicalDuration1+lexicalDuration2. The lexicalDuration is the string presentation, "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS"(e.g. P5Y2M15DT4H40M20S )
Function.name: add

Function.desc: Computes a new duration whose value is lexicalDuration1-lexicalDuration2. The lexicalDuration is the string presentation, "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS"(e.g. P5Y2M15DT4H40M20S )
Function.name: subtract

Function.desc: Computes a new duration whose value is factor times longer than the value of lexicalDuration. The lexicalDuration is the string presentation, "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS"(e.g. P5Y2M15DT4H40M20S ) Factor is the times longer of new Duration to create
Function.name: multiply

Function.desc: Returns a new Duration object whose value is -lexicalDuration. The lexicalDuration is the string presentation, "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS"(e.g. P5Y2M15DT4H40M20S )
Function.name: negate

Function.desc: Returns the sign of this duration in -1,0, or 1. The lexicalDuration is the string presentation, "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS"(e.g. P5Y2M15DT4H40M20S )
Function.name: getSign

Function.desc: Partial order relation between lexicalDuration1 and lexicalDuration2. The lexicalDuration is the string presentation, "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS"(e.g. P5Y2M15DT4H40M20S )
Function.name: compare

Function.desc: Adds this duration to a Date object. The lexicalDuration is the string presentation, "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS"(e.g. P5Y2M15DT4H40M20S ) The given Date argument is used to be modified
Function.name: addTo

Function.desc: Obtains the formatted string from specified object and pattern.
Function.name: format

property.name: pojoDataSetClassPath

property.name: INCLCOLUMNNAME

property.name: INCLTYPELINE
